meanings.definition: Tending to dribble or produce droplets of liquid.
meanings.sent1: The leaky faucet was very dribbly.
meanings.sent2: The popsicle was so dribbly that it dripped all over my hand.
meanings.sent3: The dribbly faucet made a rhythmic pitter-patter sound.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were dribbly with tears as she watched the sad movie.
meanings.sent5: The dribbly paintbrush left a trail of watercolor on the paper.

meanings.sent1: The old water bottle was very dribbly and needed to be replaced.
meanings.sent2: The roof was so dribbly that water seeped through during heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The dribbly hose made watering the garden a messy task.
meanings.sent4: His dribbly pen ruined the important document with ink blots.
meanings.sent5: The dribbly roof created a constant drip-drip-drip sound in the house.

meanings.definition: Having a runny or watery consistency.
meanings.sent1: The soup was too dribbly, more like a broth than a stew.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream melted quickly on the hot day, becoming very dribbly.
meanings.sent3: The dribbly jelly slipped off the toast and onto the plate.
meanings.sent4: The dribbly mud made it hard to walk through the field.
meanings.sent5: The dribbly sauce coated the pasta in a thin, watery layer.
